meaningMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. 

The kanji itself means <kanji>add</kanji> and this word is the verb version of that: <vocabulary>to add</vocabulary>.

This is a transitive verb, meaning that you are doing the adding to something else. You add a nose to your snowman, for example.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You decide <vocabulary>to add</vocabulary> something and then <vocabulary>to add</vocabulary> something else, and you end up with quite a <reading>qua</reading>ntity (くわ) of things. Just keep adding and adding forever. What a huge QUANTITY you now have!
